website_summaries.verdict: This natural product comes with similar concerns about effectiveness as others in its class, but also has gained many satisfied customers. You also get a lot of product for the price.
pros: Natural feline stress-alleviating formula that includes herbs and simulated pheromones
Doesn't contain harsh ingredients or preservatives
Has a pleasant scent, and comes with a money-back guarantee
cons: Some cat owners report that it reduces anxiety but not the tendency for felines to fight with each other
Won't work at all for some cats

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, But Very Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I just had my cat shaved because her hair was very badly matted. She's 15, and I noticed she's not cleaning herself as well as she used to. It's been hard for me to keep her hair mat free, since I'm dealing with health issues. I just purchased this leave in conditioner for both my cats. I noticed right away it made their dry hair smoother and softer preventing their hair from getting matted. I like that it's unscented too, since my cats do not like anything scented. I do feel it's quite expensive and wish the price would come down. I don't understand why pet shampoos and conditioners should be so much more expensive than human ones.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Mitigates cat-on-human violence
customer_reviews.text: My cranky medium-hair cat got several mats out of the blue. We ordered this to try and minimize the discomfort of removing them. While she did try to murder us, the de-matting process took considerably less time thanks to using this detangling spray along with the proper grooming tools. It doesn't have a scent that I can smell, and it didn't upset my cat's tummy. I appreciate any product that minimizes both my cat's discomfort and my odds of getting murdered by said cat.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Deman

customer_reviews.title: Purr-fect for a long drive...
customer_reviews.text: I transported two cats from Denver to Lake Havasu City, AZ this summer. Both yowl when in the car. After about 10 minutes of yowling, they both settled down and remained quiet for the rest of the 13 1/2 drive. Two days after our arrival, we drove 2 1/2 hours more to Goodyear, AZ. Again, this worked like a charm. I would recommend it for long drives.
customer_reviews.author: LSunday

customer_reviews.title: It Works! Just Need to Get Use to the Scent
customer_reviews.text: I admit, I was a little skeptical at first but this stuff works wonders. My cat loves to scratch the carpet; in fact, he scratches the carpet around the scratching post as almost in protest. But the first time I sprayed the carpet and he stopped scratching! You have to get use to the smell if you're not a fan of rosemary (I like the smell so it didn't bother me) because it can be a little overpowering. But the cats weren't bothered by the smell and no more scratching the rug! You just have to remember to keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Lindars

customer_reviews.title: No more peeing in the house!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this purchase since I was desperate for it to work. My husband wanted to send the cat packing. It worked as soon as he got a whiff! He was biting our other cat and he stopped dead in his tracks! He has gone back to his playful happy friendly self. Not on guard, or running from everything. Love bug, like he used to be. And the best part is, No more peeing in the house!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle J. Roesly

customer_reviews.title: Cat loved the smell😩
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new couch and wanted to protect it of course. We followed the directions. Cats seen us spray. Did several times a day...nothing. The main offender seemed to love the smell. He even got on the couch right after I sprayed and rolled around in it. He of course continued to claw the couch. I'm miserable. I think as the directions said, it depends on the sensitivity of the cat. Or 2 others don't go on the new couch, but also aren't dirt bags and don't claw the couch. I wouldn't recommend this product. It smelled okay, but waste of time and money. I'll look into cat nail clips now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have so many people that I am recommending this ...
customer_reviews.text: I have so many people that I am recommending this product to. If you have two cats that bicker this is the thing-the only thing I would ever recommend. ( I wish we had had this 6 years ago).
customer_reviews.author: judi

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: After trying several scratch deterrent sprays from the pet store that did absolutely nothing, I didn't hold much hope for this one but was at my wits end with my cat destroying thousands of dollars worth of furniture. After using this product twice a day as directed, I can happily report that in just 1 week, my cat has stayed away from all of the furniture I have sprayed! The smell is a pleasant rosemary fragrance and it is not damaging to the fabric at all. I would highly recommend this spray and wished I had discovered it a year ago when I got my cat! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: MassConsumer

customer_reviews.title: THIS SPRAY IS AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS SPRAY IS AMAZING!!!!!!!! I have a cat who is extremely skittish. Cash is now eight years old, I have had him since he was kitten. He has always acted like he was on acid and would bite just randomly. I would be sitting on the couch and he was just attack me. This stuff has been a life saver. Highly recommended! My neurotic cat has become a lap cat. LOVE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MBaird

customer_reviews.title: effective!
customer_reviews.text: It works. The cat doesn't know why, but she no longer wants to scratch the couch. Got her a new scratch pole and placed it in a near by but not next to corner and she goes to that now, not just sometimes as before but always. Heading into second week. Have resprayed just to get this behavior habituated if I can. And will buy a new back up spray bottle soon. What a relief. What a godsend of a product.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa

customer_reviews.title: Upset instead of calming
customer_reviews.text: Two of my five cats urinated on the spot when exposed to this spray. I sprayed it on a towel and rug that they usually laid on. When directed to the place they usually lay upon they peed on it and ran. I would like a refund. $20 is a lot to pay for something that resulted in the behavior opposite than advertised.
customer_reviews.author: QV

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately after reading all the reviews, I had such high hopes for this product, but it was a bust. Didn't get the cat to go into his carrier and actually he stopped sleeping in his bed. It made him even more nervous as he knew something was up - yes, he is smarter than us and knows we were up to something. So good money down the drain. Glad it worked for others....
customer_reviews.author: JBM

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cat fur nice and soft!
customer_reviews.text: I spray a few pumps of this onto the brush every day before brushing my persian cat. It helps keep his fur detangled and soft. It won't get mats out if he already has them, but it keeps them from getting any worse, and helps prevent him from getting new ones. He is finicky but allows me to use this on him with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: C B

customer_reviews.title: Cat resumed scratching upholstered sofa 20 min after application
customer_reviews.text: Smells exactly like citronella. I'm guessing that is its main ingredient? As mentioned in my title, didn't work for me. I am going to make my own. I've started researching what odors are unpleasant to cats and, luckily, they're ones that are far more pleasant to me than citronella. It will be nice when my living room no longer smells like an outdoor campsite.
customer_reviews.author: SLSoul

customer_reviews.title: I love the convenience of spray catnip [vs the traditional leaves] ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the convenience of spray catnip [vs the traditional leaves] but have been disappointed at times in the past with sprays. This brand is terrific, at least according to those who vote...the cats! No muss, no fuss, and whatever the "distilling process," it seems to be correspond with whatever "high" the actual leaves provide. I'm sold, and this vendor is A+.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Skipper

customer_reviews.title: About 75% effective
customer_reviews.text: This is a toss up. If you can remember to spray the deterrent three times a day, as instructed, I believe the spray will work. I did use it twice a day for a couple of weeks and it did deter my cat from scratching, however, she just moved on and returned to the spot, a couple of hours later, after the scent went away. I'd say the deterrence was 75% effective. I didn't mind the herbally smell but my kids sure did. The cat didn't like it either. If you can be home and spray the item every six hours you may have better results with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mona AlvaradoFrazier

customer_reviews.title: Fingers crossed
customer_reviews.text: We had some stray cats in the neighborhood. I have sprayed my flower gardens, where they would come to do their business at night. My cat will always alert us when they are out there, by running thru the house and meowing very loudly. So far, so good my cat hasn't sensed them for several nights.I will spray every few days to make sure they get the message.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. LabergeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Purrs and four paws up!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with an anxiety disorder. I refuse to medicate her. I do not want a "zombie kitty." The plug-in pheromones cost more and not all the plugs in the house are at the right height. This product is awesome. I spray it on the areas she sits such has her window perch, towels, scratching tree etc. After a while, I noticed she'd calmed down. It does not harm her companion cat who sleeps most of the time. Speaking of which, I sprayed it near the throw my husband uses. He took it and laid down and went to sleep. I can't testify that it works on husbands but it certainly calmed him down as well!
customer_reviews.author: Eurocat

customer_reviews.title: Best, Strongest, Authentic, Cat Nip Spray Ever!
customer_reviews.text: May cost a little more, but SO worth it! Don't spray too much! VERY STRONG! A little goes a long way. I spray a couple pumps on their toys while I'm in the house and the boyz are outside on the lanai and within 30 seconds, they both come running in (I have a kitty door that lets them go out to the screened in lanai where they have their castle and other kitty luxuries) I don't know how they smell it through concrete walls and thick sliding glass doors, but they do. Good stuff - I'll never buy another brand now.
customer_reviews.author: BrilliantIndication

customer_reviews.title: Gummy and doesn’t do anything
customer_reviews.text: My cats are still scratching the exact spots I sprayed this on. It smells good. Kind of a essential oil smell. I can feel the place I sprayed now feels kind of gummy instead of just straight fabric, so I can’t help but wonder what is in it that changes the feel of your fabric. Since it’s not doing what it said it would and is gumming up my couch, one star.
customer_reviews.author: The Kat

customer_reviews.title: It Works!!
customer_reviews.text: This really calms the kitties without making them woozy. Very natural and a pleasant fragrance too. : ) I gave it a true test when our nervous kitty had to go to the vet. All bodily fluids normally leave his body on the trip. Very nervous. I sprayed his carry case, blanket and then I sprayed it again. He was as calm as ever I've seen him on the trip AND at the vet. Wonderful stuff!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelin Y.

customer_reviews.title: Smells Great!
customer_reviews.text: Smells great, unfortunately not really working. Adopted new cat (3 yr. old) and our resident cat who is 9 yr. old does not want her in his space! Have tried everything to calm the environment. Have tried Nature's Miracle Calming Spray which I think works but couldn't find it so bought this. It may just be that nothing will help. It really just sucks to have two great cats but can't put them together after taking all the proper steps for 3 weeks. Like I said it smells great! Like lavender ~ so use it around the litter boxes and around the house. I was so hoping this would help. :(
customer_reviews.author: Lori H.

customer_reviews.title: Too greasy, left long term 'wet' look on the cat
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. This stuff works but made/ makes the cat's fur look greasy long-term (has not gone away) so he will need a bath basically to reset the whole process. I have a long hair kitty cat. Product smells fine enough and works OK but the greasy part will keep me from using it. I did not use more than two or three sprays in one area and it created that grease effect, so I don't view that as an overuse or anything.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, but I bought this to detangle a VERY ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, but I bought this to detangle a VERY timid baby, so I have to move slowly. He and I are both grateful for the lack of fragrance. I just have to figure out a way to get it on him that doesn't involve spraying it directly on his fur because that terrifies him. Currently spraying the brush in another room and then getting to work on the coat...a long process. =) I'll let you know how things are progressing.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula Best

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have two 7 month old kittens , who are wild when not sleeping. I sprayed the couch on which I don't want them to sleep or scratch. Lo and behold after a few days it worked and is still working. This stuff is great !
customer_reviews.author: KATE

customer_reviews.title: Really like!!
customer_reviews.text: Vet put my cat on Prozac. She licks off her fur on belly and legs. He said its psychological. She was a zombie on the meds. I go at the spray and she is herself , not drugged , happier and not licking as much. It been about a week.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara P.

customer_reviews.title: so good!! Our two cats had used our brand ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good!! Our two cats had used our brand new upholstered recliner as a play/scratching post for some reason. Spraying them with water wasn't fast enough but using this has worked! We've only caught one on the chair one time since spraying 3 times a day but then he jumped right off. My only reservation is that it is slightly oily on the surface but I think that's because I might have been over zealous in application. The smell isn't bad and doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: NancyG

customer_reviews.title: Cool Kitty Cat seems to work
customer_reviews.text: Cool Kitty Cat seems to work, My cats attacked a new carpet runner with claws and I love the cats and the carpet. I purchased this product hoping it would discourage them. A good number of applications didn't do much for the carpet. Recently, I took the carpet up and gave it a good all over spraying, fingers crossed the carpet seems to fairing better. The pump make it difficult to spray low lying areas because of the nature of this type of spray bottle, a trigger sprayer would be much easier to use for a better application
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie P Wood

customer_reviews.title: i love this product
customer_reviews.text: i love this product. i was trying to use coconut oil before and even though it sort of detangle it left a farly greasy mess of my cats hair. this product is wonderful and i highly recommend it. it won't work that well on giant matt balls but if you regularly use the dotingly comb with this product it works very well. my cat is no longer running from me when he sees the cat grooming tools
customer_reviews.author: carol gelfand

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: My elderly kitty started getting some hardcore mats on her tummy and her left side. After reading the reviews and checking out the ingredient list, I purchased this. This really does work. I have to go slow, so it's going to take me some time, but it's already helped get out the smaller mats easily. I am so happy I found this. And I love that it's unscented. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: lori j

customer_reviews.title: ... out I had to travel by airplane with my sweet little girl kitty to our new home
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last minute when I found out I had to travel by airplane with my sweet little girl kitty to our new home. I sprayed the pheromone spray inside the kitty carrier and on the cushioning the night before to let it dry. After some meowing for the first 30 minutes, she settled down and made it without incident for our 12 hour trip. My wife then used it for our big ol' tom cat for the same trip, also without any issues. I recommend this product if you want to travel with your kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Batchelor

customer_reviews.title: My nice couch is getting more clawed up by the day
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes...but alas. I've tried cheaper versions of no-scratch spray, and thought that maybe if I spent a little more I'd get something more potent or with more substantivity, but it worked about the same as the one I bought at Walmart for a fraction of the price (meaning it didn't work at all). My nice couch is getting more clawed up by the day :[
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: My cats go nuts for this when they feel like playing.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in fine shape within the expected amount of time. Some days my cats like the spray and other days they do not. When they DO like the spray, they are wild about it and really go to town with the toy. I do not need to spray a lot, so this bottle should last for quite some time. When they DON'T like the spray they look at me like I must be joking about them playing with the toy. I realize that sometimes they aren't in the mood to play and no amount of spray will entice them, but wonder if perhaps the spray works better on some toys than others.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta M. Lemanski

customer_reviews.title: My cat's love this!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for two things, first, to get them to love their new cat halters. I sprayed them several times until they rolled all over them and scented them with their own scents to make the transition to wearing them easier. Second, I used it to spray their scratch/cat towers and divert their attention away from my furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Smells good, cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a year old tabby that was not in a good home and was nearly feral. She growled and hissed at anyone that tried to pick her up and she mostly stayed in hiding. So I tried this product and can say it really works wonders. Sprayed it on my clothes and on the couch and she became calm and docile after sniffing it out. It’s the nursing mom cat pheromones that do it, cat smells it but we just smell nice floral scent. It is water based, does not stain, smells good, and you get 8 Oz (a lot) in a fine mist bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Harden

customer_reviews.title: It has worked for my cat's scratch habit.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work for my cat. She likes to claw at the wood around the doors and spraying the areas she liked to scratch has made her stop. I have had to reapply after a while, but that is to be expected. The scent is strong - but not unpleasant- and doesn't linger for long. The only issue I have is that despite holding my breath and trying other methods, I still manage to breathe in some of the mist. Perhaps opening the bottle and using a paper towel to wipe the product onto the surface will work better for me? I just recently used it again.
customer_reviews.author: _Beth_

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have two cats that don’t get along and one of them keeps pulling his fur out as a result. I had high hopes for this product after reading the reviews, but was sorely disappointed. One still hisses at the other and the one being hissed at continues to pull out tufts of his fur at a time. In fact, he won’t even go on his bed anymore since I sprayed this on it. Spent money on a useless product that cost me more as I need to now get him a new bed.
customer_reviews.author: KCayea

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. A must try
customer_reviews.text: With my first bottle, I was sceptical of just how well it would work. Having three cats and leather furniture, ordering your product was far cheaper than having all three cats declawed. I'm not big on writing reviews, but your product deserves not only recognition, as well as my appreciation. It not only smells amazing (lemongrass smell), it works amazingly well, and it took literally only two days for results. Thank you 😊 Sincerely, Kathleen Wolfe
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works! Best Anti Claw Spray on the Market.
customer_reviews.text: This spray is great! My cat was destroying my brand new chair. She has not clawed or even sat on it since I sprayed it. Yes, the spray is a little smelly. Not bad just different. The smell goes away after a few hours but apparently the cat can still smell it. I sprayed the chair daily for three days. Its been two weeks and she still doesn't go near the chair. This spray has saved my furniture and my relationship with my beloved cat.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Detangling Conditioning Spray
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews of this product prior to purchasing. Unfortunately, I cannot use it.My cat hates it. I contacted manufacturer asking for suggestions and was told to spray it on a paper towel or brush then try to remove the mats from my cat. I have tried all theses steps, using a pronged comb, and I cannot get my cat to stay put while doing this. I would love to return it, not sure they will allow me to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know what to expect, but so far so good, Time will really tell. I purchased a new carpet for my kitchen and I have two Persians the one proceeded to check it out by having a nap on it. Then after leaving the other cat came over and scratched up the spot where the other had lain, (claiming it her territory) Fact is she tore out the loops in the carpet. She scratches several spots around the area before I received the product. Since spraying the rug there has been no incidents. Again, time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Maine Coon and he tends to get matted down on his chest and under his front legs. This product doesn’t seem to really do anything but wet down my cats fur. I don’t feel it helps detangle or get through matted hair (I used it with a pet brush and matt remover comb/razor). No scent that I notice and no residue feeling left on my cats fur or my hands. I will be trying a different product.
customer_reviews.author: jodi kaufmann

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a long road trip!
customer_reviews.text: Calmed a nervous, screaming cat on a road trip - he calmed down after spraying his kennel with this. I honestly didn't think it would work but I have no other explanation as to why he calmed down each and every time I used this throughout our trip. It didn't work like a sedative would, as he still peeped here and there, but it took the edge off and allowed him to stop panicking.
customer_reviews.author: KLJP

customer_reviews.title: I find myself using this daily. I have two ...
customer_reviews.text: I find myself using this daily. I have two cats, one is somewhat wild. She's the one that drove me to search for pet calming products. We have purchased pills, collars, diffusers and this spray and the spray is the most effective. I spray her sleeping locations, our chairs and couches, the rug and her. I spray my hands and rub them on her coat. She calms down instantly and stops attacking the other cat. It's not alcohol based and she doesn't lick herself afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive bottle of something that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I had hopes that this spray would help unravel my cats fur mats, even just a little. What a disappointment. I could have sprayed plain water on the mats (the spray feels like water) and gotten the same results without the expense. Don't waste your money on this. If possible I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with transition, developing trust, and adaption to new settings!
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted a four year cat who had some special needs with regards to trust. We purchased the spray and sprayed her area, cushions, and transition room while working with her. She progressed well, is a lot less stressed, and is developing more trust on a daily basis. Additionally we are seeing our other five year old cat demonstrating a very calm and compassionate behavior towards her!
customer_reviews.author: A loyal customer

customer_reviews.title: Not effective and smells really strong
customer_reviews.text: I was definitely more irritated by this than my cat. My cat didn't really react to it, but in my small apartment, it stunk up the whole place. I can't imagine how it would be effective if everything smells like the spray. The bottle is also quite small and you're supposed to spray it every 3 hours. It's too much work for pretty much no effect and a stinky apartment. I do love their calming spray! Perhaps this works for others and I just didn't do it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: eva_breva

customer_reviews.title: Certainly worth a try - a lot of people have experienced a lot of success.
customer_reviews.text: I really don't know how to rank this or evaluate it as I have two cats that, although never feral, have almost no socialization. I think this helps a bit but hard to say as we cannot get very near them or even touch them. They were in shelters for months. I am using this product based on others' reviews and trying anything else with it that I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Annie M daffodils

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats began stopping on his way into the living room and working his claws on the corner of the couch. I keep his claws trimmed, but still worried about his new habit. This cat spray has stopped that. The scent is pleasant, and I used it three days as advised, and he has left the couch alone since the first day. I am pleased with the fast results and will purchase this product again as needed.
customer_reviews.author: mrsjml

customer_reviews.title: It worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bed for my cat who took to it immediately. Then my son brought home a very small dog he was watching for a friend and the dog went and laid in the cat bed. After that the cat refused to lie in that bed again. So I bought the Catnip spray and just sprayed a few squirts on the bed and it worked. The cat has once again taken to its bed. It worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Multimedia Man

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat used to get up an hour before we did and start his obnoxious demanding meowing. He's never been fed in the morning, so it wasn't about food. We have tried a lot of different products and approaches to improve his disposition, all to no avail. This spray has totally changed his personality! Too bad our vet didn't know about this - we could have saved a lot of aggravation and money, and avoided bad side effects from one of the types of pills. We've been spraying his blanket for 2 weeks and he's been better since the second day.
customer_reviews.author: Karen C.

customer_reviews.title: Sticky stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is sticky...it made a sticky film on the couch that lasted a few hours (until it dried completely). But it left a sticky film on the wood floor that did not go away- it took some scrubbing. We don't like leaving a sticky film on the floor or on the furniture so won't be using this product anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: I want you to know we have tried EVERYTHING to ...
customer_reviews.text: I want you to know we have tried EVERYTHING to get our two cats to stop using our furniture as a scratching post, and THIS has worked and they have not done it again since we started spraying it. I have had to respray it a time or two when the smell kind of wears off ... but they have learned to leave it alone and I am thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Beth S. O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Stopped spraying but cats still do not get along
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is prime item, I did not get 2 day shipping. I have been doing a cat introduction for 8 months now and I'm at my wit's end. Bought this as a last resort. It seemed to have stopped the male cat from spraying and urinating but did not help with calming and relieving anxiety. The smell is nice, better than I thought it would be. Might be worthy to note that this especially has no affect on my female cat.
customer_reviews.author: cincin

customer_reviews.title: Furniture is safe again
customer_reviews.text: Surprising results. I searched for cat repellent and this came up. I assumed it was repellent and it had good reviews so purchased. I was pretty upset to fine my cat loved my chair even more after I treated it. But she slept there. She didn’t claw it. Read the label. This isn’t designed to keep your cat away. It’s designed to keep your cat happy and avoid scratching. It works. Crazy concept but it definitely does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Maybe helped a little
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an elderly kitty I was cat sitting for who had terrible mats all over him. He was afraid of the spray hitting him so I had to spray and then wait to spray more. I think the waiting helped because it allowed the stuff to soak in. I think it did help a little to get the mats a little more movable and waiting overnight helped even more. Most of the mats, however, I had to cut out because they were too dense then this helped to get the remainder out.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Buy it yesterday
customer_reviews.text: We have had such a hard time getting our cat to stop scratching the couches, no matter what toys we bought, he preferred the couch. After repairing it several times, we decided to try this and I am SOOOO glad we did. He has not scratched the couch in weeks. This is such a huge change and happened almost immediately. I will day that the scent is not amazing, but it works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Yaaaaaaas!!! This stuff is the best!!!!
customer_reviews.text: God bless this stufffffff!!! I had to travel 600 miles with my kitties and I was crazy worried. They have never been in a carrier for more than an hour. I sprayed this stuff on their blankets and in my car before I put them in and while I was driving I would spray it on the blankets covering their carriers. They barely made a peep for 13 hours!!!!! I've tried other brands but they never worked as well as this one. I'm so grateful for this spray. It made my move much less stressful and kept my kitties mellow and happy.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: It works 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: I really like the smell of it and It does work for my curtains and couch. My Kitty literally did not look at him again after I spray them. My only suggestion is don’t Spray too much of it because even though smells pretty good if you put too much, you and your cat both will run away from the room😂. With a small amount works as well. I think we both learned something new today. My kitty not to scratch my curtains & my couch, and that is Exactly what I was looking for an a product, and me not sprayed too much of it.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Stopped cat from scratching wallpaper
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Pet MasterMind Cat Spray when my kitten started clawing at the sting wallpaper in the bedroom every night. Sprayed this on the wallpaper and it stopped the clawing on the first night! I also placed a door handle scratching post nearby (which, being a cat, she decided not to use). I used the spray every night for a week and it prevented a bad habit forming.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Claw Withdraw
customer_reviews.text: It works for a while then fades away. My cat still was hanging around my couches and I ran out of the bottle super fast. When I sprayed it in a room he would walk out of it, then comes back hours later. If you decide to buy, buy more than one bottle, better yet buy a whole years worth. I wouldn't purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Beautifulone.

customer_reviews.title: #1 cause of feline-on-feline murder
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This really does work! I've got an old Birman who won't groom himself, and although he ended up a bit greasy post-brushing, this got out a large majority of the mats and made dealing with a very severe mat much easier. Cons: Our other cat, who the old cat hates, believes that it is his life mission to lick every place the detangler has been and I suspect there will be a straight-up murder when my back is turned.
customer_reviews.author: Spectral Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my crazy cats.
customer_reviews.text: This was a big waste of money for me and my cats. I didn't notice any kind of calming or reduction in stress, in fact it increased their stress due to spraying it around the house. They are terrified of sprays, they are such scaredy cats. hahaha The calming drops didn't work either, so if this didn't work for your cat don't waste your time with the drops. Next
customer_reviews.author: calcrnflakegirl

customer_reviews.title: Smells great!
customer_reviews.text: The package says JASMINE is a key ingredient but it smells like LAVENDER to me (my 2 faves )! It is great to find a cat pheromone produce that I can tolerate!!! It seems to be calming my kitty (and me) down. But I honestly can't say HOW MUCH it is helping, since I also got another brand cat collar at the same time. I don't know which product is working the best, but together, they are working!!! Sorry. I wish I could be more definitive. =^.^=
customer_reviews.author: DEBRA LEE

customer_reviews.title: Best Catnip spray on the market.
customer_reviews.text: The best Catnip spray out there. Used lots of others. Cat's not interested (at time of writing this have 17). Tried this and they absolutely love it. This is my second bottle. Bought the 4 oz this time!. Fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: fernwood

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty suffered a broken pelvis and is confined to a crate for 6 weeks. She can't be kept on pain medications the entire time, but I simply spray this on her bedding and in the crate and she is very comfortable and calm (very unusual for her). She seems quite comfortable and happy and healing is progressing! Thank you for Cool Kitty!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Mess free and easy catnip fix for Kitty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spray catnip so that I could increase the interest of my cat in his new "play tree"...I found the green dried catnip to be messy and it lost its appeal quickly. The spray is perfect. My cat now loves his tree and I feel like I can give him a treat now and then with a simple spray. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: WillowWren

customer_reviews.title: My poor kitty gets super stressed whenever anything changes in the ...
customer_reviews.text: My poor kitty gets super stressed whenever anything changes in the house. When she is stressed she chews on the base of her tail until she bleeds. The vet recommended this spray. I spray it on all her favorite spots and things seem to be helping. The scent is very light but pleasant and dissipates quickly. I would recommend this to anyone with a stressed kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not a miracle product but it's helpful and great for your cat's skin and fur.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product for detangling and can be helpful for really stubborn mats but it's not magic. I would still recommend this for smaller mats and I have been using it on my cat's fur/skin as I have been getting huge matted areas off and noticing it is dry and not that healthy underneath. Great for their coats and dandruff. Just don't think it's going to be a miracle solution. It still takes time and effort to remove those heavy matted areas. That being said, this does help a bit and as already stated helps the skin underneath recover to a healthier state once the matted areas are removed.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Mora

customer_reviews.title: ... old Maine Coon cat who has never been the best groomer. this is not a miracle fix
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15 and a half year old Maine Coon cat who has never been the best groomer. this is not a miracle fix, but it does help. It takes a few sessions, but if you spray this in a work it through their fur it helps the mats come out. It makes his fur very silky too. I will definitely buy more when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loved to play with the beaded tassels on our really nice sheer curtains in our living room; we would often find beads and the tassels on the floor. A few sprays of the Pet MasterMind Cat Spray and no more tassels on the floor! It also works great to keep her away from the cords behind the entertainment system. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucimoon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all -- got help online
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time/money on this item. I got this to keep my kitten away from areas I didn't want him to claw or climb on. I may as well have sprayed the areas with catnip. He was attracted to the smell! He rubbed his face on everything I sprayed with this stuff. Maybe I have a weird kitten. It was completely ineffectual and it worked as a cat attractant. There are home remedies available online that proved to be effective and are much less expensive. Save yourself the money. Best of luck!
customer_reviews.author: flori-Dormouse

customer_reviews.title: Different ingredients?
customer_reviews.text: I'm scare to use it. I just bought the one with yellow marks because I'm running low on the other, but just when I was going to spray it on my cat tree I noticed the ingredients. Different from the older one. Why isn't 100% catnip?
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette Maria Reyes

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE this concentrated, long lasting, mess-free catnip spray!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE this concentrated, long lasting catnip spray! And I love the mess-free catnip delivery method. Wonderful product! When this big bottle runs out, I'll be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Very little effect.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product for a few weeks. I did see some small mats come off, but really not worth the price. I instead put some olive oil directly on the hair mats and within 4 days big hunks were finally coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried other products and this is the only one that works. Just a note: May want to spray a little of whatever product you are usingto a napkin. Place the napkin up to your cat's face. If the cat runs from the product, you know it will work. If the cat rubs on the napkin you may not want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect Kitty Love Juice
customer_reviews.text: I've never tried catnip with my cat before. I did for the first time and she (Lexie) is 15 years old and she is in LOVE! My kids also love watching her lose herself with these little mice and this cardboard toy thing I bought as well. She loves to rub herself all over it. It's awesome for her! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kaltenbach

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed, Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it might help repel mosquitoes from my cat. My young cat has sores on his ears and on his belly; the doc says he is probably allergic to mosquito bites. He's an outdoor cat and is otherwise healthy and active. The spray smells funny, my cat didn't like it and after a week I could not see any improvement in my cat's skin condition.
customer_reviews.author: P. Deans

customer_reviews.title: So I purchased this " I LOVE CATNIP " I sprayed all of the rope areas ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing! We have two young Burmese cats. Their cat tree has multiple posts wrapped in jute rope that we wish they would use for scratching but they show NO interest. So I purchased this " I LOVE CATNIP " I sprayed all of the rope areas and still nothing, our kitties still show no interest! Did it again, still nothing! They love their catnip mice...... Save your money on this spray!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Peddicord

customer_reviews.title: It certainly deterred the cats, and my boyfriend.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t leave reviews, usually ever. But, I took a chance on this and it worked....for a period of time. The price for a small bottle seems a little bit much! Since, it take A LOT, over time, to make them stop scratching. Consistency is key. My cats do a lot of their scratching at night. I spray the furniture before bed. I still hear some scratching, but if I OVER SPRAY - the smell takes in the whole house. The cats then end up hiding under our bed. That’s not the effect I was going for. Yes, it “works”, but you need to be consistent which means continuing to purchase the spray....
customer_reviews.author: Connecticut Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low stress way to help remove a mat.
customer_reviews.text: This product is working perfectly! I spray the product on my hands and then pet my cat on his matted area. He doesn’t really notice which is just awesome because everything else I’ve tried has stressed him out. I could tell that the product was loosening and softening the mat right away. The product also makes his entire coat super shiny.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Wow, my cat really loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried other catnip sprays, but my cat really goes nuts on this one. She is getting older and not as playful as she use to be, but when I sprayed this on a long stuffed toy she went crazy. she grabbed it and kicked it and licked it too. This went on for several minutes, then she took a nap hugging it. we are both very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Works great and smells great too!
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as intended (as long as you follow the product recommendations). I purchased this item to prevent my cats from scratching a new velvet sofa. Initially, I was concerned that any liquid sprays could potentially leave "water marks". After testing the product on a small and inconspicuous area on the sofa, my concerns were eased. It works great on velvet and can imaging it working just fine on other types of fabrics as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Wielepski

customer_reviews.title: Can’t stand the stink
customer_reviews.text: This spray stinks up the whole room like a giant citronella candle for mosquitoes. 🤮 And it’s way overpriced at 18.00+ dollars. Am waiting to see if my cat steers cleat if it, but I don’t know if the stink will die down after it dries, if not I will be getting a refund!
customer_reviews.author: CASSIDY BIBLE

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t scare my cats off clawing the couch the way I’d hoped. They’re not fans of the smell — a eucalyptus — but they only stay away if I catch them in the act and start spraying. Otherwise, it’s business as usual. Given the price, I was probably better off with a squirt gun or mister.
customer_reviews.author: T. Leopold

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product!! I have two cats that love to scratch our couches...I even line up their scratching posts at the couch and they just go around them to scratch. I just bought this and it is working miracles so far! I sprayed it on the scratching posts and my cats went crazy, and for the first time EVER they actually scratching the posts and not the couch!!! It smells great and I love to see how much fun they have rolling around and playing after I spray this. LOVE IT and will definitely be buying more once my first bottle runs out ! Thank you for your awesome product :)
customer_reviews.author: Megan Burger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works! I love it. My two kitties love it! Recently we had a dog move in the apartment next door. The hallway had unnerving dog smells. This product helped the kitties calm down, and little by little getting used to the new neighbor smell. Still, use it on the hallway rug and their furniture. BTW it smells divine.
customer_reviews.author: MaxandSofia

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all. Each time I sprayed it on the couches, the cats when immediately, while it was still wet, and started to scratch. Hopefully it will work for you. Maybe it was just my cats. However, I love the smell, and it acted as a great air freshener, haha!
customer_reviews.author: slrunninghard

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t help for us
customer_reviews.text: This spray did not work for our kitty. He is not as psychotic as he was at first, but not due to the spray. Time and discipline is the answer here, but doesn’t mean it won’t work for a different cat.
customer_reviews.author: s. forster

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed as I had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: My two indoor kitties don't get along - it even turns into fights often. I was hoping this would cut the tension but it really hasn't. I'm very disappointed as I had high hopes. I'll try it for a little longer to be sure, but will be returning it if I still get no positive results.
customer_reviews.author: Sue K

customer_reviews.title: Meh as a detangling spray
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the detangling spray for my senior kitty who decided that grooming was too much effort. It smells nice and all, but I ended up having to cut out the mats. I bought the spray in an effort to avoid this, but it just didn't deliver on expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving products a low rating. It makes me feel like I have been taken for an idiot. But this product will not keep cats off of your furniture or anything else that you want to keep them off of.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Bert Croft

customer_reviews.title: Enemies turned cuddle bugs
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it works! Smells a little bit like Elmer’s glue but not in a bad or unpleasant way. My cats love it. Before this, they hissed whenever they got up on this blanket together. Now they cuddle on it.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Only thing that's worked for us.
customer_reviews.text: For us, this totally works. Our cats do not like the smell and we rather do. The only downside, if you can call it that, is that we have to reapply a couple of times a day - say, morning and evening when we're on top of it. So far this product is the only thing we've found that works. If only our cats liked catnip! I'm still working on ways to get them to love scratching posts and boards.
customer_reviews.author: Elspeth B. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Nice smell; cat says “?”
customer_reviews.text: Bought to calm a travel-hatin’ feline on 1100 mile car journey with hotel stop. Did it work? Who knows. 8 hours of howling protest argues against. But if you like herbal sorts of air freshener, well...it does offer that sage-and-lavender kind of pleasantry you find in a new age boutique.
customer_reviews.author: Early Amazon adopter

customer_reviews.title: Sample size ! Overpriced  and my cat proceeded to scratch my chairs right after I sprayed them !
customer_reviews.text: Are you serious ? This is so Overpriced ! Enough product for only two uses - if you spray living room and a couple chairs . I am very disappointed ☹️ Plus it doesn’t work at all . Scent goes away within seconds and cats scratch even worse 😡
customer_reviews.author: likesugar

customer_reviews.title: Did the opposite of what it's supposed to do!?
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed this on my front door to try to keep my cat away from it after she got outside for the first time ever. I was afraid she would escape again. To my surprise, instead of staying away from the door, she actually went TO the door to inspect what the smell was!! I had to clean and wipe down everything that I sprayed this with.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought many items from Amazon, but never did a review. But this worked so well it deserves my 5 star rating. We just moved into a new place. Our cat is too busy at night to allow into the bedroom, so we close the bedroom door and he would constantly scratch at the door and meowing to be let in. I had to get up 2 or 3 times a night to chase him away from the door. The day this arrived I put it by the door and turned it on. The cat went up to it, it sprayed, cat went 4 feet straight up in the air. He hasn't come near the door when it's closed since!
customer_reviews.author: Emerald

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this.....
customer_reviews.text: This works great.......my cats are drawn to their scratchmats after spraying the mats with this. No more scratching on the walls. Seems to last a couple of days before I need to use the spray again.
customer_reviews.author: nlm

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Do a Thing
customer_reviews.text: Ah ha ha ha ha ha ha.... FAIL This spray smells nice, but it doesn't "calm the cats... The male still bullies the female no matter how much I use... What it does, when I spray it... It chases them both out of the room it is sprayed in....
customer_reviews.author: Auntie-Nanuuq

product_meta.title: Pet MasterMind Cat Spray
feature_bullets: Helps make appointments, moving, and other stressful events easier
Calming herbal formula assists with stress-induced behavioral issues
Comes in an easy to use spray.
